Configure ragg Graphics Device

Source: R/utils.R
use_ragg_device.Rd

Helper function to check if ragg is installed and provide setup instructions. The ragg package provides high-quality graphics devices that work seamlessly with system fonts, eliminating DPI issues and per-session font loading.

Usage

use_ragg_device(set_rstudio = TRUE, verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

set_rstudio

Logical. If TRUE and running in RStudio, provides instructions to set ragg as the default graphics device. Default is TRUE.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, prints detailed information about ragg status and setup. Default is TRUE.

Value

Invisibly returns TRUE if ragg is installed, FALSE otherwise.

Details

**Why ragg?**

The ragg package (based on Anti-Grain Geometry) is the modern standard for R graphics in 2025. It provides:

  • Direct access to all system fonts (no per-session loading)

  • No DPI conflicts (unlike showtext)

  • Better performance (~2x faster than cairo)

  • Cross-platform consistency

  • Automatic use by ggsave() when installed

**Setup Steps:**

1. Install ragg: install.packages("ragg") 2. In RStudio: Tools > Global Options > General > Graphics > Backend > AGG 3. Restart R session

After setup, all plots will use ragg automatically, including IDE preview and ggsave() output.

See also

setup_insper_fonts, save_insper_plot

Other utilities: check_insper_fonts(), format_num_br(), import_insper_fonts(), save_insper_plot(), setup_insper_fonts()

Examples

# Check ragg installation status
use_ragg_device()
#> 
#> ── ragg Graphics Device Status ──
#> 
#> ✔ ragg is installed
#> 
#> ── Benefits 
#> ✔ Direct access to all system fonts
#> ✔ No DPI conflicts (unlike showtext)
#> ✔ Better performance (~2x faster)
#> ✔ Automatically used by `ggsave()`
#> ✔ You're all set! ragg will work automatically with ggsave()
